intro: Blephilia heterophyla, commonly known as the purple panic grass, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces small, purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Blephilia heterophyla is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and floral display.
